repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
When 'q' is set in the shortmess and cmdheight=1 it will now fully hide showing
if you are recording a macro instead of just shortening to "recording". This
  removes duplication when using `cmdheight=1` and `vim.fn.reg_recording()` in
  the statusline.

Relates to #19193

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -116,6 +116,8 @@ The following changes may require adaptations in user config or plugins.
   upstream tree-sitter and Helix to make it easier to share queries. The full
   list is documented in |treesitter-highlight-groups|.
 
+• |shm-q| completely hides recording macro message from last line when

comment_data.body: I don't think cmdheight=1 should be mentioned here. It's misleading.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -116,6 +116,8 @@ The following changes may require adaptations in user config or plugins.
   upstream tree-sitter and Helix to make it easier to share queries. The full
   list is documented in |treesitter-highlight-groups|.
 
+• |shm-q| completely hides recording macro message from last line when
+  `cmdheight=1` instead of only shortening it.

@@ -171,12 +171,12 @@ endfunc
 
 func Test_recording_status_in_ex_line()
   norm qx
-  redraw!
-  call assert_equal('recording @x', Screenline(&lines))

@@ -171,12 +171,12 @@ endfunc
 
 func Test_recording_status_in_ex_line()
   norm qx
-  redraw!
-  call assert_equal('recording @x', Screenline(&lines))

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  call assert_equal('', Screenline(&lines))  " Nvim: shm+=q fully hides message
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -175,7 +175,7 @@ func Test_recording_status_in_ex_line()
   call assert_equal('recording @x', Screenline(&lines))
   set shortmess=q
   redraw!
-  call assert_equal('recording', Screenline(&lines))
+  call assert_equal('', Screenline(&lines))

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
	  q	do not show "recording @a" when recording a macro	
*shm-q*
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -5459,7 +5459,7 @@ A jump table for the options with a short description can be found at |Q_op|.
 		match", "Pattern not found", "Back at original", etc.
 	  C	don't give messages while scanning for ins-completion	*shm-C*
 		items, for instance "scanning tags"
-	  q	use "recording" instead of "recording @a"		*shm-q*
+	  q	do not show "recording @a" when recording a macro       *shm-q*

```suggestion
*shm-q*
```
